A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie had no point.  It was a series of scenes jumbled together without a thought to how it advanced a plot.  There was an opportunity to have a plot\, but it got sidetracked by scenes that had little to do with the resolution of the movie. And that's resolution was remarkably unsatisfying.   When you find yourself distracted by the lighted exit signs to the side of the screen and there's a lot of action going on in the screen\, I'd say that's evidence of a bad movie.  It made me want to watch Episodes 1-3\, which at least tried to do something interesting.
